intro: Trichiogramme cartilagidens, commonly known as the silky spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, woolly leaves that give it a soft, almost silky appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow, surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in southern Africa. Trichiogramme cartilagidens is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
